summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors from the Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding a sexual abuse investigation into Leon Black. The emails discuss scheduling calls, sharing information about a new cooperating witness (CW) who alleges abuse by Black and was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and coordinating their respective investigations.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The billionaire financier who is the subject of a sexual abuse investigation by both the Manhattan DA's Office and the SDNY. A new cooperating witness alleges sexual abuse by him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals, along with Jeffrey Epstein, who trafficked a new cooperating witness who has made allegations against Leon Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals, along with Ghislaine Maxwell, who trafficked a new cooperating witness who has made allegations against Leon Black.

connections.description: A new cooperating witness alleges she was trafficked by Maxwell and Epstein and then sexually abused by Black, implying a potential connection between Black and the Epstein/Maxwell network.
A new cooperating witness alleges she was trafficked by Epstein and Maxwell and then sexually abused by Black, implying a potential connection between Black and the Epstein/Maxwell network.

events.title: Coordination call scheduled
events.description: Prosecutors from the Manhattan DA's Office and the SDNY schedule a phone call to discuss their respective investigations involving Leon Black.

events.title: SDNY updates DANY on investigation status
events.description: An SDNY prosecutor informs the Manhattan DA's Office that they have no current plans to interview a specific victim and are unlikely to open another investigation unless the scope changes.

events.title: DANY reveals new cooperating witness
events.description: The Manhattan DA's Office informs the SDNY that a new cooperating witness has come forward alleging sexual abuse by Leon Black and that she was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The Manhattan District Attorney's Office was actively investigating Leon Black for sexual assault allegations as of 2023.
A new cooperating witness alleged in 2023 that she was sexually abused by Leon Black and had been trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was also conducting a parallel investigation into Leon Black, leading to coordination discussions with the Manhattan DA's Office.
The email chain shows ongoing communication and scheduling between federal and state prosecutors regarding the Leon Black investigation from 2021 to 2023.
